alert.note: Alert for Jim Hogg; Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 3:23PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Jim Hogg and northeastern Zapata Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 322 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Thompsonville, or 12 miles southwest of Hebbronville. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hebbronville, Las Lomitas, Gruy Stadium, Thompsonville, Jim Hogg County Airport, Hebbronville High School, South Fork Estates and Hebbronville Border Patrol Station. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
